item.title: Pergamon
item.dc:creator: import
item.content:encoded:
From from a few manuscripts to large text corpora's, the Pergamon environment publishes your data as accessible web content. Enrich with data from Timbuctoo and our standoff-annotation server. It comes with a powerful search engine and data visualisations.

Pergamon in action

Correspondences (beta) is an expanding set of correspondence datasets. Search in nearly 30.000 letters from Hugo Grotius, Rene Descartes to Willem Witsen and Albert Verwey. The Rijks Geschiedkundige Publicatiën (RGP) are an extensive collection of sources concerning the Dutch history. Over 450 volumes have been published by Huygens ING and its predecessor Institute of Dutch History (ING). They contain official reports and recommendations, file records, correspondence, diaries, lists and inventory. Huygens ING Dutch historical resources (beta) aims to publish digital sources and data responsibly and with care. Innovative tools are made as widely available as possible. We strive to share the available knowledge at the institute with both academic peers and the wider public.

item.title: Timbuctoo
item.dc:creator: import
item.content:encoded:
Why Timbuctoo

Timbuctoo is specifically designed for academic research in the Arts and Humanities, which often yields complex and heterogeneous data. It lives up to academic standards for working with such content: the infrastructure accommodates different views on a subject and leaves the interpretation of the data to the researcher. Also, Timbuctoo keeps meticulous track of data provenance and does not impose a certain research methodology on its users. Data can be searched and analyzed through the web interface, or queried using the API.

Timbuctoo implementations

Huygens ING uses Timbuctoo to share its data with the world and to host high quality datasets of ongoing research projects in which the institute participates. Timbuctoo also forms the backbone of Anansi, the central CLARIAH infrastructure. Anansi will be the data hub between the three primary CLARIAH domains (Linguistics, Social & Economic History and Media Studies). Furthermore, Anansi will link up with large-scale existing data infrastructures outside CLARIAH and allow researchers to connect their own datasets. The International Institute of Social History in Amsterdam and Oxford University (the Cultures of Knowledge project) have announced to implement Timbuctoo in their digital research infrastructures.

Features

Data management

Keep full control of your data with user-friendly data management tools.

Data enrichment

Timbuctoo is well-suited to making connections between data from different sources. It does not, however, combine records by itself. Instead, Timbuctoo suggests a possible match to the user, who can then choose to accept or decline.  

Privacy and sharing options

You can choose to keep your dataset private or open it to the world.

Powerful search and analysis tools

Gain insight in your data with Timbuctoo’s easy-to-use faceted search and data analysis tools.

API

For computerised access to the data in Timbuctoo, an API is provided.

Multiple interpretations of data

Timbuctoo accommodates different views on a subject. It leaves the interpretation of the data to the researcher.

Provenance tracking

Timbuctoo keeps meticulous track of data provenance: what is the source of the data and who has uploaded or edited it?

Combine and create datasets

Timbuctoo can create new datasets, combining data from various other datasets, according to specific user needs.

Replication of data analysis

Timbuctoo is a dynamic system. It will contain a growing number of datasets over time and some of these will be in a process of constant updating. In order to make replication of data analysis possible, Timbuctoo always shows version information and will store and give access to previous versions of the database system.

Data export

You can export data from Timbuctoo to the following file formats: csv, JSON, GraphML.

Technology

The basic structure of the software is a set of REST API’s on top of a linked data store (implemented on Neo4j), offering developers the opportunity to build clients interacting with these data. Currently the infrastructure provides:

  • end user GUI’s for uploading, searching and editing the data;
  • a GUI for browsing the LOD web and connecting found entities to your own dataset;
  • the ability to access the data as an RDF graph or as a REST (document oriented) datastore;
  • an implementation of R2RML, enabling the conversion of existing relational data to RDF;
  • various importers for binary formats;
  • the ability to discover and download datasets from remote servers that contain ResourceSync descriptions;
  • the ability to subscribe to changes on a dataset, which enables the creation of post-hoc data stores (e.g. MongoDB, MySQL) optimised for specific query patterns.
Timbuctoo is constantly being maintained and updated by the developers of Huygens ING. It is open-source and freely available under GPL v3. Please refer to GitHub for a detailed description of technological features and information for engineers of research institutions who wish to implement in their digital infrastructure.

item.title: Corporate Services
item.dc:creator: bdo
item.content:encoded: There are four departments within corporate services: Facilities & Support, Finance & Control, P&O and Marketing & Communication.

item.title: Facilities & Support
item.dc:creator: bdo
item.content:encoded:
The Facilities & Support department is there to make sure everything works as it should. The department makes sure there is a receptionist to welcome guests and new employees. They make sure all offices are well equipped and they can help you book flights and hotels.

The department can be reached as follows:

  • Secretary: secretariaat@bb.huc.knaw.nl (link sends e-mail)
  • Reception: receptie@bb.huc.knaw.nl (link sends e-mail)
  • Facilities: facilitair@bb.huc.knaw.nl

item.title: Finance & Control
item.dc:creator: bdo
item.content:encoded:
The Finance & Control department is responsible responsible for managing the financial resources. The department takes care of the financial administration (including creditors and the debtors).

The central e-mailaccount of the department is financien@bb.huc.knaw.nl.

Digital invoices (pdf) can be sent to this account as well.

item.title: P&O
item.dc:creator: bdo
item.content:encoded:
The personnel working at the P&O department available to answer any questions on personnel matters (such as status, salary, career opportunities and career advice) and also to discuss any matters of a confidential nature.

The central e-mailaccount of the department is personeelszaken@bb.huc.knaw.nl.

item.title: Marketing & Communication
item.dc:creator: bdo
item.content:encoded:
The Marketing & Communication department can help you make your research known to a broader audience. If you need advise, contact the department and they will tell you what to do. Maintaining the corporate websites and all newsletters is another responsibility of this department.

The central e-mailaccount of the department is communicatie@bb.huc.knaw.nl.

item.title: Concern infrastructure
item.dc:creator: bdo
item.content:encoded: The concern infrastructure department is responsible for maintaining all the website. The department also makes sure all the data of the Huc is safely stored. The HuC has many digital collections. Keeping them up to date, developing software and tools and making sure they can be researched, is an important task of the department.

item.title: Collection management
item.dc:creator: bdo
item.content:encoded: The institutes of the HuC have several collections. Each collection is managed by a collection hea. They decide what to add to the collections, advice on whether or not a collection should be made public and / or digital.

item.title: homepage
item.dc:creator: import
item.content:encoded: We develop Digital Infrastructure for humanities research. Our R&D department facilitates new ways to do research.

item.title: Updates
item.dc:creator: import
item.content:encoded: Here are some updates:

item.title: Page format
item.dc:creator: import
item.content:encoded:
• About Pergamon
  • Features
  • Technology
  • Implementations
    • Correspondence
    • RGP
  • Updates / new features
  • Feedback
  • Roadmap
  • Github
  • Product owner
  • Team

item.title: R&D
item.dc:creator: import
item.content:encoded: The Research & Development Team aims for innovation in research methodology in the humanities. It builds prototypes to demonstrate that a new/proposed approach is actually viable, putting emphasis on data models and methods that support the richness of the humanities datasets, and the complexicities of the use cases. Multidisciplinary cooperation, both inside the team and with researchers from Huygens ING and elsewhere, provides experimental solutions for problems experienced by researchers. These solutions are made available as open source prototypes or in academic publications and presentations shared with the research community and may eventually be integrated into Digital Infrastructure’s products. The Research & Development Team’s work currently encompasses three themes, which can be continued or supplemented in line with developments in the humanities. Digital Infrastructure has had a Research & Development Team since 2015.

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: bdo
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: bdo
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Hosting Legacy
item.dc:creator: bdo
item.content:encoded: The HuC has many sites that are no longer in active use, but still hold important information. This is the hosting legacy. Making sure these website stay online, without being hacked.

item.title: Computational services
item.dc:creator: bdo
item.content:encoded: Computational science (also scientific computing or scientific computation (SC)) is a rapidly growing multidisciplinary field that uses advanced computing capabilities to understand and solve complex problems. It is an area of science which spans many disciplines, but at its core it involves the development of models and simulations to understand natural systems.

item.title: Server Hosting
item.dc:creator: bdo
item.content:encoded: The growing digital data collections of the HuC makes server hosting a challenge. Keeping the servers up and running is an important task.

item.title: Mission Statement
item.dc:creator: bdo
item.content:encoded:
Per 1 oktober 2016 is het bedrijfsbureau van het Humanities Cluster (BB HuC) officieel gestart. Het BB HuC is gevormd met medewerkers van de clusterende instituten en NIAS en NIOD. Een aantal medewerkers blijft verbonden aan de standplaats IISG. Het grootste gedeelte van de medewerkers is gehuisvest in de binnenstad van Amsterdam, met name in het Oost Indisch Huis (OIH) en Spinhuis. Deze panden maken tezamen met het Bushuis onderdeel uit van het BOS-complex. De taken van het bedrijfsbureau kunnen worden verdeeld in een aantal kerngebieden. De kerngebieden zijn: •    Human Resource en salarisadministratie •    Huisvesting en onderhoud •    Secretariële en administratieve ondersteuning •    Financiële transactieverwerking en rapportering •    Governance, risicobeheer en compliance •    Prestatiemanagement (business control) •    Veiligheid, gezondheid en duurzaamheid

De basis van de taken van het bedrijfsbureau is het ondersteunen van de medewerkers het management en de directie (‘ontzorgen’) in de dagelijkse werkzaamheden. Zonder hierbij de eigen verantwoordelijkheid van de medewerkers, management en directie over te nemen.

Daarnaast is het voorzien van betrouwbare informatie aan de organisatie een basistaak. Het bedrijfsbureau zorgt dat de primaire bedrijfsprocessen op orde zijn en dat er een goed werkend intern beheersingssyteem en risicomanagementsysteem is. Het bewaken van de continuïteit is een belangrijke taak.

Het bieden van een veilige, gezonde en prettige werkomgeving is eveneens een basistaak van het bedrijfsbureau.

Beslissingsondersteuning is, tot slot, ook een belangrijke taak van het bedrijfsbureau. Het faciliteren van inzicht en overzicht en het geven van advies aan medewerkers, management en directie met als doel het nemen van de juiste (of afgewogen) beslissing voor het instituut en het Cluster. Dit vindt plaats op operationeel, tactisch en strategisch niveau.

Missie Het BB HuC ondersteunt de instituten en haar medewerkers om op een verantwoorde wijze de strategische doelstellingen te realiseren. Daarbij stimuleert en begeleidt het BB HuC de instituten om bedrijfsmatig te opereren in ieders taakgebied. Hierbij is er een continue streven naar het signaleren en doorvoeren van verbeteringen in de bedrijfsvoering en de risicobeheersing.

Visie Het BB HuC zal als afdeling groeien naar een continue lerende en zichzelf verbeterende afdeling waarin werkzaamheden eenvoudig van elkaar kunnen worden overgenomen en betrouwbare informatie een vanzelfsprekendheid is. De instituten worden met behulp van een hoog kennisniveau (ook van de instituutsactiviteiten en de omgeving waarin de instituten opereren) optimaal ondersteund in het nemen van beslissingen.

Ambitie Het BB HuC heeft de ambitie om de instituten op optimaal te ondersteunen tegen een acceptabel kostenniveau, waarbij de medewerkers binnen een veilige en integere werkomgeving kunnen opereren en voldoende ruimte wordt geboden voor zelfontplooiingsmogelijkheden.

De kernwaarden van het BB HuC zijn: Integriteit (eerlijkheid, oprechtheid) Discretie (vertrouwelijkheid) Respect (mens telt, niet de functie) Durf vragen te stellen (biedt kans om te leren) Inclusiviteit (geen uitsluiting)

item.title: Careers
item.dc:creator: bdo
item.content:encoded:
HuC offers you the chance to do groundbreaking work and help customers with innovative, practical and smart solutions. And all that with an attractive benefits package.

Vacancies

Currently, there are the following vacancies at HuC.

Open Applications

Did you not find a suitable vacancy within our vacancies and are you interested in working at HuC? If you have (almost) completed a relevant study, check the possibility for an open application. Is your field of study not in this list? Check our vacancies.

Study

HuC is constantly searching for ambitious interns and final-year students. We are looking for students who are fascinated to get a taste of one of the world’s most prominent knowledge companies.

Your internship or graduation project at HuC? Would you like to get to know HuC during your studies? Why not do your internship or graduation project at our organisation? Around 400 students do each year. It’s a great way of starting your career within HuC.

Starters / PhD

As a starter at HuC you have many options. You can specialize or you can develop in a broader sense. You could become a boardroom consultant or top researcher. Or maybe you see yourself as an R&D engineer or leading a project. HuC offers you fantastic prospects in which you have a great deal of freedom and responsibility in shaping your career.

Currently, we are mainly looking for students and graduates in the disciplines: Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Mathematics, Econometrics, Electrical Engineering, Physics, Aerospace Engineering and Mechanical Engineering. And also for other educational backgrounds, we always have challenging jobs, internships and graduation assignments.

HuC presents you with a wealth of options. What is your aim: to become a top researcher or a consultant, project manager or business developer? From the moment you enter employment with us you enjoy major freedom in, and responsibility for, shaping your own career path.

PhD studies and positions at HuC are closely linked with our research initiatives and departments. The doctoral education programme combines academics with methodological schooling and hands on experience.

The typical length for the PhD programme is three years and is comprised of one semester of additional study and 2.5 years of dissertation work and research. Each doctoral candidate's study is typically financed by a research fellowship.

Discover HuC / Department

Do you want to do ground-breaking work in multidisciplinary projects, seek out new knowledge? Are you ambitious and energetic, a thinker and a doer? HuC is the choice for you.

As a starter at HuC you have many options. You can specialize or you can develop in a broader sense. You could become a consultant or top researcher. Or maybe you see yourself as an R&D engineer or leading a project. HUC offers you fantastic prospects in which you have a great deal of freedom and responsibility in shaping your career. From the moment you join us, your career development is in the spotlight, in part through the special Talent Development Programme or the traineeship. As a new colleague you get an extensive introduction and education programme so that you can feel quickly at home at HuC and get off to a flying start.

From future vision to technological innovation, from societal trends to practical embedding, the translation of customer need to business opportunities, the development and maintenance of strategic partnerships. HuC gives you freedom and challenge within different societal themes. We are looking for professionals able to connect with customers and colleagues, to look for new markets and in pursuit of a career.

Selection Process

Everything starts with your resume, make sure it looks good and suits the position you are applying for. And make sure your motivation is distinctive, because you are not the only one interested in a career at HuC. After a positive review of your CV and motivation, you will be invited to a preliminary interview, followed by a second interview with employees working in your chosen field and, possibly, a presentation assignment.

The third round for starters comprises an assessment. This applies also to professionals who may also be interviewed by the Director of Research before moving on to a fourth round interview with the Managing Director. You will be contacted (by phone) within three working days and may be invited to a continuation of the selection process.

Diversity

Diversity contributes to the efficiency and effectiveness in achieving our organisational goals. We see the power in the market by the use of multidisciplinary teams. Through the efforts of a diverse workforce we are more innovative and creative than when we would work with homogeneous teams. We take better decisions and in the long run we perform better.

Increasing our problemsolving abilities, wanting to attract the right people, but also our social responsibility is for us reason to to embed diversity in our organisation and our behaviour.

All Services for expats

For new employees from foreign countries HuC takes care of a number of things. Below you can find an overview of all services HuC offers to expats.

Coming to the Netherlands

Employees relocating to The Netherlands will be supported by ‘Crown Relocations’. Depending on the country of origin, familiarity with The Netherlands, the household situation etc. a package is put together from the services mentioned below. Airport Meet & Greet accompanied transfer from the airport to the accommodation.

Preview trip

Including a Welcome Pack containing maps and general information, introduction to practical and cultural aspects of life in The Netherlands, a visit of the area and the city and a visit of several housing possibilities.

Moving

Including supplying all necessary packing materials, the dismantling of standard furniture, delivery into residence, unpacking and reassembly of the dismantled furniture Accommodation Accompanied viewing of preselected houses, lease negotiations, utility connections, inventory preparation, liason between expat and letting agent/landlord and accompanied home check-in.

Education

Introduction to local and international school systems, assistance in school selection and application, accompanied visit to preferred schools and information on day care and kindergartens.

Settling-in assistance

Accompanied visits for local registration and obtainment of Social Security Number, opening bank account, Information on changing drivers’ license, providing names and addresses of family doctors and dentists, neighbourhood orientation and information on public transport, home essentials health care system, personal finance, etc.

Partner Career Support

Focus on the individual goals with a career consultant. CV/Résumé advice, Interviewing techniques, applications etc., introduction into networking opportunities.

VISAS

Depending on the country of origin, it may be possible that the employee needs a working or employment visa to stay and work in The Netherlands. HuC will take care of the necessary visas.

30% TAX RULING

The 30% tax ruling is a fiscal facility for foreign employees who are coming to work in The Netherlands (temporarily) and have specific experience or expertise which is not, or rarely available in the Netherlands. An employee can be eligible for this tax ruling if a number of conditions are met. The 30% tax ruling can be applied for a maximum of 8 years.

Training in Dutch language and culture

To support the expats in making a successful start in the Netherlands, HuC offers training in the Dutch language and culture.

Dutch individual tax return

The employee can make use of support in filing tax returns over the year of arrival in The Netherlands by a company selected by HuC.

No rights may be derived from the content of this document.
